Abstract
The Company of Strangers

Introduction

How many strangers do you “meet” everyday? Why is the Human Species different from all others? Those two questions are not unrelated !!

The Human Species is perhaps unique in that we are able to cooperate with strangers!! Yes! Do you think that building and conducting a business is something like that? No? Well, let us see a few quick stories!!

Story-1

Let us watch a (very) small part of this movie, The Three Musketeers -1973

And here is an older, slightly longer version:

Fiction Time!

This is the conversation that occurs right before the duel scene we saw in the video above, from the book, the three musketeers.

Chapter 5. THE KING’S MUSKETEERS AND THE CARDINAL’S GUARDS.1 Keep an eye on the conversation!

And an ear open for Frenchi-fied English, I beseech you2!!

Story-2

What about this game3 ?

Discussion-1

What emotions or motivations are portrayed by the characters in the story?

  • Reward
  • Regret aka FOMO
  • Risk
  • Retribution

Nice Guys Finish First

Discussion-2

Are there COSTs to ACTIONs? Who decides?

  • Players
  • Payoffs
  • Rules
  • Strategies

What strategies are possible as a bowler in Cricket? As a batsman? What strategies are permitted? By whom?

The Game of Trust

And finally, let us play a Game, the Game of Trust (Website) !

Robert Axelrod’s Study on Cooperation

This is a famous study of the Iterated Prisoners’ Dilemma by Robert Axelrod, The Evolution of Cooperation,(PDF)

And here is Robert Axelrod on the RadioLab Podcast:

Spotify:

Transcript: https://www.wnycstudios.org/podcasts/radiolab/segments/104010-one-good-deed-deserves-another

Prisoners’ Dilemma: A Case Study

The story of Southwest Airlines’ Early Bird Check-In (Weblink)

Case Study: Hotelling’s Phenomenon

Why are Hotels and Petrol Pumps located next to each other? (Weblink)

What are the Assumptions in Game Theory?

  • That gains and pains can be quantified
  • Rationality
  • Players have identical and opposed aims (Symmetry)
  • In most cases, the game is zero-sum, but not always!!
  • Some form of spoke/unspoken agreement as to what may and may not be done ( i.e Rules of the Game )

Here is a good Summary of modern thinking about Human Cooperation: The Evolution of Human Cooperation, PDF

Game Theory Pop Music, Movie Clip, and TV ad Playlist !!

  1. Bachchan vs Warsi: Want a Pepsi - Tit for Tat https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gc6QZcxbMZE

  2. The Gods Must be Crazy (Brinkmanship) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9LvViKftRnA

  3. The Princess Bride - Battle of Wits - Which Strategy to Use here? (Asymmetric Information) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rMz7JBRbmNo

  4. Chris de Burgh: Don’t Pay the Ferryman! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q-a5TAL-IXs

  5. Abba: The Name of the Game https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T5Qf_7HM1cM

References:

  1. John D. Williams, The Compleat Strategyst: Being a Primer on the Theory of Games of Strategy, RAND Corporation, ISBN:9780833042224. This is a very humourous and fun book on Game Theory ! It is available for free online at the RAND Corporation Website.

  2. Ken Binmore, Playing for Real: A Text on Game Theory, ISBN:9780195300574, Oxford University Press, March 2007. Available (here.)

  3. Avinash Dixit, Susan Skeath, David Reiley, Games of strategy, ISBN: 9780393124446, New York :W.W. Norton & Company, 2015.

  4. Brams Steven J., 1994. “Game Theory and Literature,” Games and Economic Behavior, Elsevier, vol. 6(1), pages 32-54, January.PDF

  5. Alexander Mehlmann,The game’s afoot! Game theory in myth and paradox, American Mathematical Society 2000. (AMS Bookstore.)

## Introduction

How many strangers do you "meet" everyday? Why is the Human Species
different from all others? Those two questions are not unrelated !!

The Human Species is perhaps unique in that we are able to [cooperate
with strangers](https://fee.org/media/4316/547_42.pdf)!! Yes! Do you
think that building and conducting a business is something like that?
No? Well, let us see a few quick stories!!

### {{< iconify pajamas issue-type-test-case >}} Prisoners' Dilemma: A Case Study

The story of Southwest Airlines' **Early Bird Check-In**
[(Weblink)](https://mindyourdecisions.com/blog/2013/03/05/southwest-airlines-boarding-and-game-theory/)

### {{< iconify pajamas issue-type-test-case >}} Case Study: Hotelling's Phenomenon

Why are Hotels and Petrol Pumps located next to each other?
[(Weblink)](https://mindyourdecisions.com/blog/2008/03/25/game-theory-tuesdays-hotelling%e2%80%99s-game-or-why-gas-stations-have-competitors-nearby/)

### {{< iconify mdi thought-bubble-outline >}} What are the Assumptions in Game Theory?

-   That gains and pains can be **quantified**
-   Rationality
-   Players have identical and opposed aims (Symmetry)
-   In most cases, the game is **zero-sum, but not always!!**
-   Some form of spoke/unspoken agreement as to what may and may not be
    done ( i.e Rules of the Game )

Here is a good Summary of modern thinking about Human Cooperation: *The
Evolution of Human Cooperation*,
[**PDF**](The%20Evolution%20of%20Human%20Cooperation%20–%20The%20Evolution%20Institute.pdf)

    Theory of Games of Strategy*, RAND Corporation, ISBN:9780833042224.
    This is a very humourous and fun book on Game Theory ! It is
    available for free online at the [**RAND Corporation
    Website.**](https://www.rand.org/content/dam/rand/pubs/commercial_books/2007/RAND_CB113-1.pdf)

2.  Ken Binmore, *Playing for Real: A Text on Game Theory*,
    ISBN:9780195300574, Oxford University Press, March 2007. Available
    [**(here.)**](https://djvu.online/file/yFqEW5Mqk0aVd)

3.  Avinash Dixit, Susan Skeath, David Reiley, *Games of strategy*,
    ISBN: 9780393124446, New York :W.W. Norton & Company, 2015.

4.  Brams Steven J., 1994. "Game Theory and Literature," Games and

    January.[**PDF**](http://www.sscnet.ucla.edu/polisci/faculty/chwe/austen/brams1994.pdf)
